_meanings:
(<ab>Nom.</ab> <ab>du.</ab> {#dvO#} {%<ab>m.</ab>%}, {#dve#} {%<ab>f.</ab>%},
{#dve#} {%<ab>n.</ab>%}) Two, both; {#sadyaH#} 
{#parasparatulAmaDirohatAM dve#} <ls>R. 5. 68.</ls> ({%<ab>N. B.</ab>%} In <ab>comp.</ab>
{#dvA#} is substituted for {#dvi#} necessarily 
before {#daSan, viMSati#} and {#triMSat#}, and 
optionally before {#catvAriMSat, paMcASat, zazwi#},
{#saptati#} and {#navati, dvi#} remaining 
unchanged before {#aSIti#}). [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>L.</ab> {%duo%},
{%bis%} or {%bi%} in <ab>comp.</ab>; <ab>Gr.</ab> {%duo%}, {%dis%}; Zend
{%dva%}; <ab>A. S.</ab> {%twi%}.].

an aggregate or molecule of two
atoms a diad.

‘a son
of two persons or fathers, an 
adopted son who remains heir to his 
natural father though adopted by
another.

a
collection of two verses or ṛks.

{1} a crow (there being two
{%Kas%} in the word {#kAka#}).

{2} the ruddy
goose (there being two {%kas%} in the
word {#koka#}).

exchanged or bartered for two
cows.

a sub-division of the
Tatpuruṣa compound in which the
first member is a numeral; {#dvaMdvo#} 
{#dvigurapi cAhaM#} <ls>Udb.</ls>

{1} a man of any of the first three
castes of the Hiṇdus (a Brāhmaṇa,
Kṣatriya or Vaiśya); see <ls>Y. 1. 39.</ls>

{2} a Brāhmaṇa (over whom the
Saṃskāras or purificatory rites are
performed); {#janmanA brAhmaRo jYeyaH#} 
{#saMskArErdvija ucyate#}.

the sacred thread worn by the first
three castes of the Hindus.

{1} a trench
or basin round the root of a
tree for holding water.

{2} a
trough near a well for watering
birds, cattle, &c.

{2} a pseudo-Brāhmaṇa,
one disguised as a Brāhmaṇa.

an epithet of Viṣṇu, (having
Garuḍa for his vehicle.).

{1} a man
of any of the first three castes
of the Hindus; <ls>Ms. 2. 24</ls>

{1} belonging to the first three
castes of the Hindus.

{1} the sign {%visarga%} consisting
of two dots.

{%<ab>a.</ab>%} having thirty-two 
auspicious marks upon the body.

{2}
Bṛhaspati, the preceptor of the gods.

N of 
Jaimini's Mīmāṃsā in twelve 
Adhyāyas.

{1} a period of
twelve days; <ls>Ms. 5. 83</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">11. 168.</ls>

{1} twelve years old, lasting for
twelve years; <ls>Pt. 1.</ls>

the
twelfth day of a lunar fortnight.
a cow tied with two ropes.

a ceremony lasting for two
days.

{2} a cross-way, a place
where two roads meet.

an epithet of
{1} Gaṇeśa. 
{2} king Jarāsaṃdha.

a long vowel (having two
syllabic instants.)

{1} a variety of interpretation
or reading.

{2} a word correctly
written in two ways.

a
kind of house or structure with 16
angles (sides).

a kind of light 
carriage drawn by mules.

worth or bought
for two hundred.

ploughed in two ways, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} first 
lengthwise and then breadth-wise.

worth or bought for two golden
coins.
